intro.description:
The Quality Testing tool is an external Java library that can be included in your working project. You can do it by two ways:
- Using Maven dependencies
- Including directly the JAR in the project

item.title: Using Maven
item.description: If you use Maven with your project, you can automatically include QT-LIB in your project.

command.serialization: org.eclipse.ui.browser.openBrowser(url=https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.github.dice-project/qt-lib/,browserId=maven-qt-tool,name=Quality Testing Maven,tooltip=Quality Testing Tool in Maven Central Repository)

subitem.label: Click on the latest version of QT-LIB, e.g., 1.0.0.
Copy an paste the dependency in your pom.xml

item.title: Without using Maven
item.description: If you do not use Maven, you can manually include QT-LIB by adding the latest JAR file to your Eclipse Project Classpath.

command.serialization: org.eclipse.ui.browser.openBrowser(url=https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.github.dice-project/qt-lib/,browserId=maven-qt-tool,name=Quality Testing Maven,tooltip=Quality Testing Tool in Maven Central Repository)

subitem.label: Click on the latest version of QT-LIB, e.g., 1.0.0.
Download the latest version of the QT-LIB jar, e.g., http://central.maven.org/maven2/com/github/dice-project/qt-lib/1.0.0/qt-lib-1.0.0.jar
Include the jar in your project classpath
